page.title: 03Tilwick Meadow
page.content: Near the ruined Manor House at Tilwick there is a medieval meadow which the farmer is not allowed to plough.In April the meadow looks very beautiful for there are lots of yellow cowslips in bloom.Later on in June rare orchids flower.In the fields nearby some interesting archeological discoveries have been made.Pottery and iron slag have been found.The Roman pottery ranges from the 1st to the 4th centuries.It is mostly beige and it is not glazed.The medieval pottery dates from the 11th to the 14th centuries and has a jade green glaze.We know that there were iron works here in Roman times because lumps of spongey slag and tap slag have been found.The iron ore was brought here from Northamptonshire because there were many woodlands here to provide fuel for smelting.
